title: WATCH: AP reporter recalls covering Ted Bundy
text:
Ted Bundy smiles during the second day of jury selection for his murder trial. (AP Photo, File)

Dan Sewell spoke to Ted Bundy's mother during the trial.

Sewell recalls Bundy as friendly, interesting to talk to, and really engaging.

He concludes that it might be one of the reasons why Bundy remains fascinating and the subject of books and movies today.

After the execution by electric chair of Bundy, people cheered as the killer was finally gone.

description: Associated Press reporter Dan Sewell recalls covering serial killer Ted Bundy. Thirty years after his death in Florida's electric chair, his murderous charm continues to captivate and perplex.
